data.name: Leavanny
data.flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

abilities.name: Leaf Tailor
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Cutting Arm
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Swadloon
data.flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Petilil
data.flavorText: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: The Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Lilligant
data.flavorText: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.

attacks.name: Aromax
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Windmill
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Karrablast
data.flavorText: When they feel threatened, they spit acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémon targets Shelmet.

attacks.name: Mysterious Evolution
attacks.text: If Shelmet is in play, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Foongus
data.flavorText: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.

data.name: Amoonguss
data.flavorText: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Shelmet
data.flavorText: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

attacks.name: Mysterious Evolution
attacks.text: If Karrablast is in play, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Accelgor
data.flavorText: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Virizion
data.flavorText: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Wallop
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Leaf Wallop attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600° F.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and being flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.text: Move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

attacks.name: V-create
attacks.text: If you have 4 or fewer Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

attacks.name: Double Fire
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Incinerate
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

attacks.name: Fiery Dance
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Seismitoad
data.flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: It lives in water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

data.name: Tirtouga
data.flavorText: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Cover Fossil

data.name: Carracosta
data.flavorText: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 50 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

attacks.name: Icicle Barb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Vanilluxe
data.flavorText: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.

attacks.name: Double Freeze
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. If either of them is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Frillish
data.flavorText: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: It conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Jellicent
data.flavorText: The fate of ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitats: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

abilities.name: Cursed Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Cryogonal
data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

attacks.name: Ice Chain
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Frost Vanish
attacks.text: You may return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: Cryogonal
data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Kyurem
data.flavorText: It generates powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Emolga
data.flavorText: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

attacks.name: Electrichain
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage if you have any Lightning Pokémon on your Bench.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

abilities.name: Dynamotor
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Stunfisk
data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.

attacks.name: V-blast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

attacks.name: Damagriiigus
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves in past ages. Each retains memories of its former life.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Garbage Collection
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.

abilities.name: Durable Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gunk Shot
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Duosion
data.flavorText: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

data.name: Reuniclus
data.flavorText: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Net Force
attacks.text: Does 40 damage times the number of Reuniclus you have in play.

data.name: Solosis
data.flavorText: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

data.name: Elgyem
data.flavorText: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.

attacks.name: First Contact
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Elgyem
data.flavorText: This Pokémon had never been seen until it appeared from far in the desert 50 years ago.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Reuniclus
data.flavorText: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

attacks.name: Dizzy Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Beheeyem
data.flavorText: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

attacks.name: Synchronoise
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that shares a type with the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel it burns.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

attacks.name: Luring Light
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leaches off the life force of any who follow it.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Chandelure
data.flavorText: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.

abilities.name: Cursed Shadow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Eerie Glow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

data.name: Gurdurr
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Gigalith
data.flavorText: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

attacks.name: Core Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Timburr
data.flavorText: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Conkeldurr
data.flavorText: They use concrete pillars as walking canes. They know moves that enable them to swing the pillars freely in battle.

attacks.name: Chip Away
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Conkeldurr
data.flavorText: It it thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

abilities.name: Craftsmanship
abilities.text: This Pokémon gets +20 HP for each Fighting Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Top Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Archen
data.flavorText: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Plume Fossil

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Archeops
data.flavorText: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.

abilities.name: Ancient Power
abilities.text: Each play can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Stunfisk
data.flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a volt of electricity.

attacks.name: Trickle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Mienfoo
data.flavorText: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attack. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

data.name: Mienshao
data.flavorText: It wield the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arms attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Golurk
data.flavorText: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Terrakion
data.flavorText: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Landorus
data.flavorText: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."

attacks.name: Abundant Harvest
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Hammer
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: They fight at Bisharp's command. They cling to their prey and inflict damage by sinking their blades into it.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

attacks.name: Finishing Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Night Slash
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Deino
data.flavorText: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

data.name: Zweilous
data.flavorText: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Escavalier
data.flavorText: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Hydreigon
data.flavorText: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

abilities.name: Dark Aura
abilities.text: All Energy attached to this Pokémon are Darkness Energy instead of their usual type.

attacks.name: Berserker Blade
attacks.text: Does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Blades comprise this Pokémon's entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Scissors
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Cobalion
data.flavorText: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Breaker
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Axew
data.flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves against Heatmor.

attacks.name: Devour
attacks.text: For each of your Durant in play, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Audino
data.flavorText: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Fraxure
data.flavorText: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they've been fighting.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Druddigon
data.flavorText: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cover Fossil
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Tirtouga you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Haxorus
data.flavorText: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: N
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a card for each of his or her remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rocky Helmet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Virizion
data.flavorText: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Wallop
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Leaf Wallop attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Plume Fossil
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Archen you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Xtransceiver
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Eviolite
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is a Basic Pokémon, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Super Rod
rules: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and being flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.text: Move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: N
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a card for each of his or his remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: This is an extremely rare Meowth card. Maybe good fortune will come to you if you hold this card!

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Cobalion
data.flavorText: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Breaker
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Terrakion
data.flavorText: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.
